text.0: ye vasus twain ye rudras full of counsel grant us strong strengtheners when ye stand beside us.
text.1: what wealth aucathya craves of you great helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.
text.2: who may give you aught vasus for your favour for what at the cows place ye grant through worship.
text.3: wake for us understanding full of riches come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.
text.4: as erst for tugras son your car seacrossing strong was equipped and set amid the waters.
text.5: so may i gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.
text.6: may this my praise preserve ucathyas offspring let not these twain who fly with wings exhaust me.
text.7: let not the wood ten times uppiled consume me when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.
text.8: the most maternal streams wherein the dāsas cast me securely bound have not devoured me.
text.9: when traitana would cleave my head asunder the dāsa wounded his own breast and shoulders.
text.10: dīrghatamas the son of mamatā hath come to length of days in the tenth age of human kind.
text.11: he is the brahman of the waters as they strive to reach their end and aim their charioteer is he.
